    • Getting started with gapxplore

    Getting started with gapxplore

    getting-started.Rmd

    Overview

    gapxplore is an R package for the unit ETC5523: Communicating with Data.
    It ships a tidy Gapminder panel (gm_panel), continent aggregates (gm_trends), a latest-year snapshot (gm_summary), and an interactive Shiny app.

    This vignette shows how to:

    • inspect the packaged data,
    • reproduce the key aggregates,
    • and launch the Shiny app.
    library(gapxplore)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(ggplot2)

    Data included

    Country–year panel

    gm_panel contains one row per country–year (1952–2007, 5-year steps).

    dplyr::glimpse(gm_panel)
#> Rows: 1,704
#> Columns: 6
#> $ country   <fct> "Afghanistan", "Afghanistan", "Afghanistan", "Afghanistan", …
#> $ continent <fct> Asia, Asia, Asia, Asia, Asia, Asia, Asia, Asia, Asia, Asia, …
#> $ year      <int> 1952, 1957, 1962, 1967, 1972, 1977, 1982, 1987, 1992, 1997, …
#> $ lifeExp   <dbl> 28.801, 30.332, 31.997, 34.020, 36.088, 38.438, 39.854, 40.8…
#> $ gdpPercap <dbl> 779.4453, 820.8530, 853.1007, 836.1971, 739.9811, 786.1134, …
#> $ pop       <int> 8425333, 9240934, 10267083, 11537966, 13079460, 14880372, 12…

    Basic checks:

    range(gm_panel$year)
#> [1] 1952 2007
unique(gm_panel$continent)
#> [1] Asia     Europe   Africa   Americas Oceania 
#> Levels: Africa Americas Asia Europe Oceania

    Latest-year snapshot

    gm_summary keeps one row per country for the most recent year in the panel (usually 2007).

    head(gm_summary)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 6
#>   country     continent  year lifeExp gdpPercap pop_mill
#>   <fct>       <fct>     <int>   <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 Afghanistan Asia       2007    43.8      975.     31.9
#> 2 Albania     Europe     2007    76.4     5937.      3.6
#> 3 Algeria     Africa     2007    72.3     6223.     33.3
#> 4 Angola      Africa     2007    42.7     4797.     12.4
#> 5 Argentina   Americas   2007    75.3    12779.     40.3
#> 6 Australia   Oceania    2007    81.2    34435.     20.4
summary(gm_summary$pop_mill)
#>     Min.  1st Qu.   Median     Mean  3rd Qu.     Max. 
#>    0.200    4.505   10.515   44.021   31.210 1318.680

    Continent–year aggregates

    gm_trends aggregates the panel by continent and year:

    • mean_lifeExp — mean life expectancy
    • mean_gdpPercap — mean GDP per capita
    • pop_total — total population
    dplyr::glimpse(gm_trends)
#> Rows: 60
#> Columns: 5
#> $ continent      <fct> Africa, Africa, Africa, Africa, Africa, Africa, Africa,…
#> $ year           <int> 1952, 1957, 1962, 1967, 1972, 1977, 1982, 1987, 1992, 1…
#> $ mean_lifeExp   <dbl> 39.13550, 41.26635, 43.31944, 45.33454, 47.45094, 49.58…
#> $ mean_gdpPercap <dbl> 1252.572, 1385.236, 1598.079, 2050.364, 2339.616, 2585.…
#> $ pop_total      <dbl> 237640501, 264837738, 296516865, 335289489, 379879541, …

    Reproduce a key plot

    Trend lines by continent 

    ggplot(
  gm_trends,
  aes(year, mean_lifeExp, colour = continent)
) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 1) +
  labs(x = NULL, y = "Life expectancy (years)", colour = NULL) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")

    Try GDP per capita:

    ggplot(
  gm_trends,
  aes(year, mean_gdpPercap, colour = continent)
) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 1) +
  labs(x = NULL, y = "GDP per capita (US$)", colour = NULL) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")

    Bubble view (latest year) 

    yr <- max(gm_panel$year)
latest <- dplyr::filter(gm_panel, year == yr)

ggplot(
  latest,
  aes(gdpPercap, lifeExp, size = pop / 1e6, colour = continent)
) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.8) +
  scale_size_area(name = "Population (millions)", max_size = 14) +
  scale_x_log10() +
  labs(x = "GDP per capita (log scale)", y = "Life expectancy (years)", colour = NULL) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")

    Launch the Shiny app

    The app is packaged under inst/app. Start it with:

    gapxplore::run_app()

    How to use the app

    • Filter by continent and year range to focus on a subset.
    • Switch metrics (life expectancy, GDP per capita, population).
    • Use the “Compare” and “Bubble” views to explore patterns and outliers.

    Reproducibility note

    All datasets are derived from the CRAN gapminder package at build time (see data-raw/build_gapminder_data.R).
    License: Gapminder (CC BY 3.0).
